come the effects of illegal discrimination in employment.
In response to these court decisions, some schools and companies voluntar-
ily took steps to overcome what they saw as the effects of past discrimination.
These steps required them to use racial classifications, and that raised the issue
of reverse discrimination. Part of the issue was about what to call such pro-
grams. Their opponents label them “reverse discrimination,” but their defend-
ers refer to them as “a
